response_parsed.title: Refactoring Microservices using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide provides an overview of refactoring existing microservices into a more efficient and scalable architecture using FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs in Python 3.12+.
key_points: Adopting FastAPI to build a new version of your microservice with improved maintainability and performance
Leveraging type hints, automatic documentation, and built-in features for validation and testing
Migrating your API endpoints from an existing framework like Flask or Django
Implementing asynchronous processing and handling multiple requests concurrently using FastAPI's built-in support
Utilizing Pydantic for data modeling to simplify validation and serialization of complex data structures

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI, HTTPException
app = FastAPI()

def my_endpoint(request: Request):
    # Your implementation here...

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for using FastAPI's latest features
Make sure to install the necessary dependencies: fastapi, uvicorn, python-multipart, and aiofiles
caveats: FastAPI has a steeper learning curve compared to some other web frameworks like Flask or Django
Ensure proper error handling and validation when migrating from an existing microservice to FastAPI
